column4: I'm sorry of being persistent, but can anyone help me solve my dhcp problem? I've been trying all kinds of stuff but nothing seems to work out... I'm also a total noob when it comes to linux:)
after installing nvidia drivers kdm got stuck, so I returened it to the "nv" driver, but after logging in again to kdm there's no connection to the internet anymore
it's set to dhcp but it doesn't receive an address anymore, but it used to work just fine
yeah, I copied what I saw on my other pc which has windows but no luck
I tried to set the same gateway address
but anyways dhclient broadcasts to all addresses right? so it supposed to find the modem
it's not wireless it's wired
admtek card
I could, but it's all in Japanese, is it still fine by you?:)
which os are you running? version?
on a  terminal   sudo dhclient eth0
ifconfig -a   and pastebin your result please
I did ifconfig -a, where should I paste the results?
can you kindly paste your /etc/network/interfaces  ?  the one you just pasted shows no ip address assigned to eth1
sure, but are there any other commands you'd like to see? since it takes to to move the data, I'd rather copy as much as I can at once
the file /etc/network/interfaces should be that many lines, maybe you can post them here, separate each line with ";"
the file /etc/network/interfaces should not* be that many lines, maybe you can post them here, separate each line with ";"
pasted in http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/54794/
2 lines are wrong, dont put those ip address in line 3 and line 4
yes, remove those two lines
oh sorry about that:)
deleted those 2 lines but still no effect
is there anything else I could try out?
are you still there?
